Package algorithms

Class BruteForceSearch

java.lang.Object
algorithms.BruteForceSearch
public class BruteForceSearch extends Object
Implements a brute-force search algorithm to solve the Pentomino puzzle.

The strategy: 1. Try each Pentomino piece in each possible position on the board. 2. For each piece, try every possible mutation (rotation/flipping). 3. If a piece can be placed without overlap or going out of the board's bounds, place it on the board. 4. Recursively try to place the next piece. 5. If all pieces are placed successfully, a solution is found. 6. If not, remove the last placed piece (backtrack) and try a new position/mutation.

This deterministic approach ensures every possibility is tried, but may be time-consuming.

  • Method Details

    • basicSearch

      public static boolean basicSearch(int[][] field, int width, int height, int currentPentomino)
      This method attempts to solve the puzzle using a recursive brute-force approach.
      Parameters:
      field - The 2D grid representing the current state of the field, where -1 indicates an empty space and any other number indicates a placed pentomino piece.
      width - The width of the field.
      height - The height of the field.
      currentPentomino - The index of the current Pentomino piece being placed.
      Returns:
      true if a solution is found, false otherwise.

    • filledMatrix

      public static boolean filledMatrix(int[][] field)
      Checks if all cells of the field are filled.
      Parameters:
      field - The 2D grid representing the current state of the board.
      Returns:
      true if all cells are filled, false otherwise.

    • addPiece

      public static void addPiece(int[][] field, int[][] piece, int pieceID, int col, int row)
      Adds a pentomino piece to the field.
      Parameters:
      field - The 2D grid representing the current state of the board.
      piece - The pentomino piece to be placed.
      pieceID - The ID of the pentomino piece.
      col - The column where the top-left cell of the piece will be placed.
      row - The row where the top-left cell of the piece will be placed.

    • removePiece

      public static void removePiece(int[][] field, int[][] piece, int col, int row)
      Removes a pentomino piece from the field.
      Parameters:
      field - The 2D grid representing the current state of the board.
      piece - The pentomino piece to be removed.
      col - The column where the top-left cell of the piece is placed.
      row - The row where the top-left cell of the piece is placed.

    • canPlace

      public static boolean canPlace(int[][] piece, int col, int row, int[][] field, int width, int height)
      Checks if a pentomino piece can be placed on the field without overlap or going out of bounds.
      Parameters:
      piece - The pentomino piece to be checked.
      col - The column where the top-left cell of the piece will be placed.
      row - The row where the top-left cell of the piece will be placed.
      field - The 2D grid representing the current state of the board.
      width - The width of the field.
      height - The height of the field.
      Returns:
      true if the piece can be placed, false otherwise.
